comments.commentBody: I'd like to hear more information about adult ADD/ADHD and its impact on personal relationships.  My husband has recently been diagnosed with Adult ADH.  He is very accomplished in his profession, and extremely driven in his work.  He's found a field in which ADHD, particularly the hyper-focus aspect of it, is an asset.  However, at home with his family his ADHD traits can make him quite difficult to live with.  I"m left "holding the bag" with the mundane details of life - paying bills, filling cars with gas, arranging kid's schedules... all of that falls to me, as he forgets everything and doesn't pay attention to anything we discuss.  It's hard not to see this as a judgment about what is important to him - after all, he doesn't forget things at work! While I've worked hard to understand ADHD, and i certainly agree that it is a legitimate disorder and that my husband has suffered from it all of his life, as a spouse it is hard to manage.  It sometimes seems like there is a fine line between the disorder and simply being inconsiderate.  Is there any way to treat these issues successfully?  I need to know if there is some hope that these aspects of our relationship could change or improve over time.

My 9 year old son has been on metadate 30mg for a year for ADHD. He is also considered gifted and has sensory seeking needs.  He gets a lot of exercise with swim team, ice skating and other seasonal sports which definitely helps. I have a few questions - 1. how long can we expect him to be on medication? 2. We take him off of the medication on weekends and breaks from school to minimize the negative effects of the medication (appetite loss and sleep loss) - is this worthwhile? Or it it better for the child to have the consistency of being on the medication all the time.  3. Is there anything we can do to conteract the effects of the medication? 4. Does ADHD ever go away with time (for example does the medication help create new pathways in the brain to help correct the problem?). 5. What are the top things you would suggest to help a child with ADHD turn into a functioning adult? 6. We also have bedwetting issues at age almost 10 - I understand this is common with ADHD - any suggestions on fixing or should we wait it out? Looking forward to reading your answers. Thank you for your time!

According to recent census data, more young Americans are marrying later and less frequently than ever.
In 2000, the number of Americans who had never been married surpassed the number who was married for the first time on record.
Many parents say this is due to mostly: Nobody has a job anymore, so they can't afford even a modest wedding and to buy a house and settle down.
Ironically, many singles, especially in urban areas, the common misdirect is “I don’t Want settles.” Experience tells me that even those folks want to settle, they don’t have financial resource and stable income to do so.
I am manager of large apartment complex; you can’t believe how many tenants late on their rent Way before the current recession.
It is very natural people live alone when they can’t even secure their next month rent on regular basis. Many Americans have hard time to admit that they are poor, especially here in NYC.

I like this!! I get Current on Fios, (channel 192).

His audience will follow him!

I just sent the following email to Mr. Obama:

Mr. President:

You have failed us again.

The Egyptian police, who, acting for Mubarak, attacked peaceable protestors with Molotov cocktails, are continuing to arrest and torture youth leaders and reporters. Meanwhile, your representative turns out to be an agent for the Egyptian Government, and your administration advocates keeping our pet dictator in power. In the eyes of the Arab street, you have legitimized Iran. Now, no Arab public, perhaps no Muslim public, will trust us for at least the next decade.

I am so sorry that I voted for you,

Joel A. Levitt
WOW.....WOW....I can't wait!

"Top rated"?

Please. He was barely a gnat in the cable realm and that is barely a gnat compared to the networks.

It is entirely reasonable to suggest that his departure from MSNBC was because of his profound inability to generate revenue. Let us see what the futre holds for this Murrow wannabe. I suspect PBS in the longer term.
this marriage is not going to last. Jacob
It will be terrific to have him back.  Somebody please buy Comcast's 10 percent stake in Current TV.  Like oil and water.
How about it Dolan's?  Let's get this going on Cablevision along with BBC America.  OWN just doesn't cut it.

you know people we have two frauds sharing a bed. isnt america beautiful! both deserve to be on public financed radio. most of america does not watch or listen to current or npr. but the american tax payer still has to pay. because liberal leftwing banter is dead in america! any one heard of air america. it gave minn a clown as a senator. just cant get 600 felons off the voting block. but he does fit right into the democrats mind and thinking!
Perfect.  One wacko working for another wacko.
Good place for him. He can do the ten year countdown to perdition for Mr. Gore. Five years down, five to go before the earth is too hot for its inhabitants.

As a former contributing journalist to Current, I think this could be a good move for Olbermann. He could breathe life into the network, one that was born out of great ideals but has languished a bit lately. I'd even think about subscribing to cable tv again!
I miss Keith but am not sure I want to watch him on a channel who's key feature at the moment is a show glorifying killing your own animals (shown in detail) for dinner "Kill it Cook it Eat it". Ugh.

Of all the tv and radio partisan hosts, left and right, Mr. Olbermann was by far my least favorite. While I recognize his talents, he was rude to his fellow hosts if they disagreed with him, petulant and angry, and richly deserved it when he was demoted from campaign co-anchor. In my view, he helped MSNBC become the partisan unwatchable channel it has become in the evenings (still like Morning Joe). Doesn't matter where he goes, I won't be watching or listening.
I can't wait, hope this goes through, we definitely need some truth in news to counteract the fascist propaganda being forced on us by the ultra-rich wackos.
Olbermann and Gore:  The whole is less than the sum of the parts, which weren't much too begin with.
So if he is now part owner, he owns part of nothing. He's definitely getting what he's worth.

I hope the speculation on Current is untrue. Keith would obvious explode Current's numbers into the stratosphere, but as he builds it, there would be too much time during which Current's low accessibility will mean only small number of people would see Keith in his new incarnation.

Much better, and what we hope for, is that Keith was able to cut deals with an over-the-air broadcast transmitter which also enjoys a place in the basic cable line-up, such as TBS Atlanta or WGN Chicago. We further want the deal to include live simultaneous streaming on the web, for any people who can't get a tv broadcast, but who can get access to the internet. Last, there's no reason why Keith's new program shouldn't be broadcast live, simultaneous on radio --- on the AM radio side. Keith's proven he gets the numbers to justify the efforts on these 3 levels, and the point of the exercise is to gain Keith much greater exposure than he enjoyed at MSNBC.

Now should I be among Keith's advisers? Is the Pope Catholic???
Hutch - info@impeachthem.com

Current isn't a public affairs channel. It started as a channel that solicited viewer-created video on a variety of topics then morphed into something more than that and then recently morphed into an outlet for documentaries and some reality fare with a couple of in house productions including the formerly watchable infoMania, which is no longer so since its format change.

Very interested to see what this pairing of Keith and Current looks like.
Never ever trust Comcast.

Current TV has set up a presentation with advertisers for Wednesday afternoon in Manhattan to announce its future plans. The channel may be betting on Mr. Olbermann to put it on the cable map. The low-rated five-year-old channel needs the help. Targeting young people, it originally subsisted on YouTube-style submissions and video journalists. More recently it started producing and acquiring traditional television series, like repeats of “This American Life.”

Really ? I'm 53 - I think not folks.
Who’s Keith Olbermann??
